metadata.title: CVE-2017-3317 mysql: Logging unspecified vulnerability (CPU Jan 2017) (moderate)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Logging). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.53 and earlier, 5.6.34 and earlier and 5.7.16 and earlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS v3.0 Base Score 4.0 (Availability impacts).

criterions.comment: mariadb-galera-server is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
mariadb-galera-common is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
mariadb-galera is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
